elastic

Class ElasticUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • elastic.ElasticUtils

  • public class ElasticUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    ElasticUtils class. Contains methods that may be used for operations in elasticsearch for inserting data.
    Since:
    0.1-SNAPSHOT
    Version:
    0.1-SNAPSHOT
    Author:
    Space Hellas S.A.

        Logger Instance.

      • restHighLevelClient

        private org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient restHighLevelClient
        High level Elastic REST client. It wraps low level client for doing operations in Elastic.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ElasticUtils

        public ElasticUtils(java.lang.String elasticHost,
                    int elasticPort,
                    java.lang.String elasticUsername,
                    java.lang.String elasticPassword)
        Constructor. It creates a high level Elastic REST client, for https methods. It skips self-signed certifications validation. Simpe authentication using username and password is required.
        Parameters:
        elasticHost - String Ip of Elastic host.
        elasticPort - Integer Port number in Elastic port.
        elasticUsername - String Username for Authentication.
        elasticPassword - String Password for Authentication.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeElasticIndex

        public boolean initializeElasticIndex(java.lang.String indexName)
        Initialize Elastic index. Check if the given index exists. If it is not exists, create it. Number of shards and number of partitions are default (equal to 1).
        Parameters:
        indexName - String Name of the index.
        Returns:
        Boolean Returns true if the initialization completed or the index already exists. Returns false, if the index cannot be created (if it is not exists) and if any error occurs.

      • initializeElasticIndex

        public boolean initializeElasticIndex(java.lang.String indexName,
                                      int numShards,
                                      int numPartitions)
        Initialize Elastic index. Check if the given index exists. If it is not exists, create it. Number of shards and number of partitions are set from parameters.
        Parameters:
        indexName - String Name of the index.
        numShards - Integer Number of shards for this index.
        numPartitions - Integer Number of partitions for this index.
        Returns:
        Boolean Returns true if the initialization completed or the index already exists. Returns false, if the index cannot be created (if it is not exists) and if any error occurs.

      • existsIndex

        private boolean existsIndex(java.lang.String indexName)
        Checks if a given index exists in Elastic.
        Parameters:
        indexName - String The name of the index to check.
        Returns:
        Boolean Returns true, if index exists. Returns false otherwise or if any error occurs.

      • createIndex

        private boolean createIndex(java.lang.String indexName,
                            int numShards,
                            int numPartitions)
        Creates a new index with specific number of shards and partitions.
        Parameters:
        indexName - String Name of the index to be created.
        numShards - Integer Number of shards to be used.
        numPartitions - Integer Number of partitions to be used.
        Returns:
        Boolean Returns true if index successfully created. Returns false if any error occurs.

      • insertJsonDoc

        public boolean insertJsonDoc(java.lang.String jsonDoc,
                             java.lang.String indexName)
        Inserts a JSON document in an existing index.
        Parameters:
        jsonDoc - String String representation of a JSON document.
        indexName - String Name of the index, that the document will be inserted.
        Returns:
        Boolean Returns true if the documented successfully inserted (or updated). Returns false for any other result or if any error occurs.

      • insertJsonDoc

        public boolean insertJsonDoc(java.lang.String jsonDoc,
                             java.lang.String docId,
                             java.lang.String indexName)
        Inserts a JSON document in an existing index with given Id. Id must be unique in index.
        Parameters:
        jsonDoc - String String representation of a JSON document.
        docId - String Id of the document, that will be inserted.
        indexName - String Name of the index, that the document will be inserted.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the documented successfully inserted (or updated). Returns false for any other result or if any error occurs.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes high level Elastic REST client.
